verses.verse: GOOD name is better than great riches, and loving favor than silver and gold.
The rich and the poor meet together; the LORD is the maker of them both.
A prudent man sees an evil man scourged and is greatly instructed by it; but fools pass by and suffer loss.
The result of humility is reverence for the LORD, and riches and honor and life.
Snares and traps are found on a crooked way; he who keeps his soul shall be far from them.
Train up a child in the way he should go; and when he is old he will not depart from it.
The rich shall be ruled by the poor, and the servant shall loan to his former lender.
He who sows iniquity shall reap deceit; and the staff of his anger shall be broken.
He who has a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he gives of his bread to the poor.
Destroy evil, cast out strife, do away with contention and reproach, lest they sit in the assembly and reproach all who are present.
The LORD loves him who is pure in heart and is gracious to the lips of the king's friends.
The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge and destroy the words of deceit.
When he is sent on an errand, the sluggard says, There is a lion on the road! and, Behold, there is murder in the streets!
The mouth of a strange woman is a deep pit; he with whom the LORD is angry shall fall into it.
Foolishness moves the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
He who oppresses the poor adds to his evil; and he who gives to the rich, shall suffer a loss.
Incline your ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply your heart to my knowledge.
For both of them are pleasant, keep them within you; let them together be made ready on your lips.
That your trust may be in the LORD, I have made these things known to you this day, even to you.
Behold, this is the third time that I have written them to you,
That I might make you know counsel and knowledge and peace and the words of truth; so that you could answer words of truth to him who might send to you.
Do not oppress the poor because he is poor; neither afflict the needy in the gate.
For the LORD will plead their cause and avenge the injustice which is done to them.
Make no friendship with wrathful man; and with a man given to anger you shall not go,
Lest you learn his ways and find a stumbling block to your soul.
Do not become a surety for a debt simply because you are ashamed to turn down those who ask you,
For if you have nothing to pay, they will take your bed from under you.
Remove not the ancient landmark which your fathers have set.
When you see that a man is diligent in his work, he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before obscure men.
